channel.title: FAQ on FreeBSD Documentation Portal
channel.description: Recent content in FAQ on FreeBSD Documentation Portal

item.title: Chapter 8. Translations
item.description:
This is the FAQ for people translating the FreeBSD documentation (FAQ, Handbook, tutorials, manual pages, and others) to different languages.

It is very heavily based on the translation FAQ from the FreeBSD German Documentation Project, originally written by Frank GrÃ¼nder elwood@mc5sys.in-berlin.de and translated back to English by Bernd Warken bwarken@mayn.de.

8.1. What do i18n and l10n mean?

i18n means internationalization and l10n means localization. They are just a convenient shorthand.

i18n can be read as "i" followed by 18 letters, followed by "n". Similarly, l10n is "l" followed by 10 letters, followed by "n".

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions About The FreeBSD Mailing Lists
item.description:
Abstract

This is the FAQ for the FreeBSD mailing lists. If you are interested in helping with this project, send email to the FreeBSD documentation project mailing list. The latest version of this document is always available from the FreeBSD World Wide Web server. It may also be downloaded as one large HTML file with HTTP or as plain text, PostScript, PDF, etc. from the FreeBSD FTP server. You may also want to Search the FAQ.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions for FreeBSD
item.description:
Abstract

This is the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) for FreeBSD. Every effort has been made to make this FAQ as informative as possible.

1. Introduction

Welcome to the world of FreeBSD! In this section, we provide a comprehensive overview of what FreeBSD is, its origins, goals, use cases, and the community behind it.

Discover the reasons behind its name, learn how to contribute to this project, and explore the rich ecosystem of FreeBSD within the context of open-source operating systems.
